summary: This document is an email chain from October 31, 2019, forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It contains a message from Kelley Lynch, a civilian witness, expressing concerns about Jeffrey Epstein's death, the conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), and the medical examiner's refusal to re-examine the case or hand over DNA evidence. She states Epstein is a criminal but dead, shifting focus to the circumstances of his death.

persons.name: Kelley Lynch
persons.context: She sends an email to the U.S. Attorney's Office questioning the handling of Jeffrey Epstein's death investigation, the conditions at MCC, and the medical examiner's refusal to re-examine the case.

persons.name: Dr. Baden
persons.context: Mentioned by Kelley Lynch as having presented conclusions about Epstein's death; she respects him and questions why the medical examiner won't re-examine the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (United States v. Jeffrey Epstein); described as a criminal by Kelley Lynch, but dead, so she questions the investigation into his death at MCC.

connections.description: Kelley Lynch is a civilian witness communicating about Epstein's case and death, expressing her views on his criminality and the investigation.
Kelley Lynch references Dr. Baden's conclusions and expresses respect for him while questioning the medical examiner's actions.

events.title: Email correspondence about Epstein's death
events.description: Kelley Lynch sends an email to the U.S. Attorney's Office raising concerns about Epstein's death, MCC conditions, and the medical examiner's refusal to re-examine the case or provide DNA.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), leading to questions about the circumstances and investigation.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Kelley Lynch, a civilian witness, contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office on October 31, 2019, about Jeffrey Epstein's death and the investigation.
She questioned why the medical examiner refused to re-examine Epstein's case or hand over DNA evidence, despite Dr. Baden's conclusions.
Lynch expressed concerns about the horrendous conditions at MCC and suggested Epstein's death might have been a murder, given the denial of bail.
She stated that while she believes Epstein was a criminal, his death means there's nothing left to say about his alleged crimes, shifting focus to the death investigation.
